descr.p: "Auf Wiederseh'n Sweetheart" is a popular song and a cover version of "Auf wiedersehen, auf wiedersehen" written by German composer Eberhard Storch.

The English language lyrics were written by John Turner and Geoffrey Claremont Parsons. The best-known version of the song was recorded by English singer Vera Lynn. The story goes that Vera was on holiday in Germany and heard people singing the song in a pub, and when she got back she felt she had to record it, so found the music and had lyrics written.

The recording of the song by Vera Lynn which featured accompaniment by Soldiers, Sailors and Airman of HM Forces, was the first song recorded by a foreign artist to make #1 on the Billboard charts, in 1952.

, The song was written by Eberhard Storch in hospital for his wife Maria as he was long time ill. So far as I remember he said to me in the 1970'ies, as he was my teacher, that he knew the CIO of a large US record company who was a pilot and captured in the 2.nd world war. This one helped him to publish the song in the US., A lot of broadcasts and TV shows in Germany ends since the fifties with this song.,
